newsitem.title: JAPAN: PRESS DIGEST - Top Japan business news - Nov 19.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Top Japan business news - Nov 19.

text.p: Mitsui & Co Ltd plans to tie up with Bertelsmann AG in multimedia businesses, including broadcasting, publishing, mail-order sales and computer software development. The two companies will start a mail-order service in Japan next spring and catalogue sales on European television. Mitsui will buy a stake in an affiliate of the Bertelsmann television station and become the first Japanese company to become involved in broadcasting in Europe.

Precision equipment makers are considering starting joint production ventures in China to gain a foothold in the local market. Olympus Optical Co Ltd plans to set up a factory for compact cameras by next spring. Canon Inc will also start production of copy machines by early next year.

Toshiba Corp plans to postpone sales of digital video disc (DVD) players in the United States to late January or early February, due to a delay in transferring U.S. movies to the DVD-compatible format. Toshiba planned to sell the DVD players by the end of this year.
Dai Nippon Printing Co Ltd, Sumitomo Chemical Co Ltd, Toray Industries Inc and Mitsubishi Chemical Corp plan to start mass-production of colour filters used for liquid crystal display (LCD) panels.
